Detailed Description

StackedDialogVisualSpec

Class defining the visual specification of a stacked dialog which consists of a background image, arrows for cycling among the available entries and a set of positions for the overlay items that will appear in the dialog.

         +-----------------------------------------------+
         |      +---------------------------------+      |
         |      |                                 |      |
         | <|   |                                 |   |> |
         |      |                                 |      |
         |      +---------------------------------+      | 
         +-----------------------------------------------+

There is an area of the stacked dialog that will contain overlay items. This area is defined by the two diagonal screenpoints itemUpperLeftPoint, itemLowerRightPoint. The argument numItems defines how many items will be displayed inside this box. The items will be placed proportionally inside it and their positions will be dependant upon how many items are displayed.

All ScreenPoints that are used in this class are referring to the offset relative to the upper left corner of the background image. I.e. ScreenPoint(10,10) refers to the position 10 pixels down and 10 pixels to the right of the upper left corner of the background image.

For configurations with more than one OverlayItem position, MapLib will allow either the first or last defined position to be empty, to denote that there are no more items in the stack in those directions.

Member Function Documentation

static StackedDialogVisualSpec* WFAPI::StackedDialogVisualSpec::allocate ( const ImageSpec *  dialogBackground,
const ScreenPoint &  focusPoint,
const ScreenPoint &  itemsUpperLeftPoint,
const ScreenPoint &  itemsLowerRightPoint,
const ImageSpec *  leftArrowImg,
const ScreenPoint &  leftArrowCenterPos,
const ImageSpec *  rightArrowImg,
const ScreenPoint &  rightArrowCenterPos,
const OverlayItemVisualSpec *  visualSpec,
const OverlayItemVisualSpec *  tappedVisualSpec 
) [static]

Creates a new stacked dialog. With a separate OverlayItemVisualSpec for items being tapped.

Initially the reference count will be set to 1. Once you are done with this object, you will need to call removeReference to ensure that the object is properly deallocated.

Parameters:
dialogBackground The background image of the stacked dialog.
focusPoint The focus point of the backgrond, i.e. this is the point of the image that should be focused on a certain coordinate on the map (i.e. the tip).
itemsUpperLeftPoint The upper left point of the rectangle indicating where the items will be drawn.
itemsLowerRightPoint The lower right point of the rectangle indicating where the items will be drawn.
leftArrowImg The image representing the left arrow
leftArrowCenterPos The center position of the left arrow
rightArrowImg The image representing the right arrow
rightArrowCenterPos The center position of the right arrow
visualSpec The visual specification which describes how OverlayItems should be rendered inside the stack view dialog.
tappedVisualSpec The visual specification which describes how OverlayItems should be rendered inside the stack view dialog when being tapped.
